title: Refrigerator Damper
description: Refrigerator Damper PartSelect Number PS11751310 Manufacturer Part Number WPW10257451

installationInstructions.author: John from DALLAS, NC
installationInstructions.title: Fridge too cold. Food freezing. Water line frozen. Running too long.
installationInstructions.content: Removed 2 screws holding cover (one on left; one behind air filter on rear wall), removed cover, removed styrofoam duct, unplugged and removed old damper. The styrofoam duct broke slightly during the removal process. This was easily fixed with some 3M spray adhesive. While the adhesive dried, I packed the air passage between the fridge & freezer with paper towels to help the fridge cycle a bit (this worked surprisingly well). After finally installing the new damper and repaired styrofoam duct, the fridge went right back to freezing the food again (I soon realized this was caused by a VERY SMALL air leak where the new damper mates with the flange located on the freezer). After making a gasket with some self adhesive1/8" thick weatherstripping and applying it to the damper, things are back to normal operation.
